item.description:
Are you ready for dim sum?

Fellow Foodie Laura is and so am I so let's enjoy good cheap eats.

Dim sum is a very affordable and delicious feast. It's family dining which means sharing. We select food from carts that are wheeled to our table. The price for each person shouldn't be anymore than $20 but most likely $15. Check out the Hei La Moon Dim Sum Menu for an idea of what will be on the carts. You can also order separately from a menu...safe but not as adventurous.

We will be joined by members of the Onyxbirds and Portuguese meetups

We'll gather outside at 10:45 AM then we'll head inside at 11:00 AM.

Here's a helpful dim sum primer written by fellow BBLDer Pam Phillips

PARKING: Call Hei La Moon 88 Beach Street 02111 (617) 338-8813 for advise, otherwise here are a few options.

Central Chinatown Garage * 86 Beach Street 02111 (617) 542-1549 above restaurant with validated parking though a little confusing. You pay the parking garage attendant $11 upon entry and then take your parking ticket to Hei La Moon, where you pay another $3 to get your ticket stamped. As you exit the parking garage you give your stamped parking ticket back to the parking garage attendant who refunds your original payment....at least that is how it worked a last year.

Super 88 Market lot 8 AM til 7 PM * 85 Essex St $10 cash

Stanhope Garage lot 617 262 0691 * 33 Essex Street (entrance corner of Essex St and Harrison St) $22 cash

Bradford Auto Parks lot 617 423 2375 * 125 Essex Street (entrance on Kingston St) $10 cash

INTERPARK Shoppers Garage 617 426 7717 * 40 Beach St $10 cash

Boston Common Garage 617 954 2098 * 0 Charles St (bet Boylston St and Beacon St) $11

Hyatt Regency Hotel Parking (Pilgrim Lafayette Garage) (617) 723-1488 * 1 Av de Lafayette bet Chauncy St and Washington St) $14 credit card or cash (take your ticket to get validation stamp from Macy's gift wrap in basement for $4 discount pay cashier before you return to your vehicle)

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: Create your own train and/or bus route here MBTA or Hop Stop Subway stations are South Station (red line & commuter rail) and Chinatown (orange line)

POST DINING ACTIVITY OPTIONS:

1) Burn off a few calories by walking around Chinatown and/or the Common.

2) Check out a movie at AMC Loews - Boston Commons 19 located at 175 Tremont Street.

3) Check out Faneuil Hall Marketplace's First Annual Street Theater Festival.

Rules of Engagement for This Meetup:

If it is less than an hour from the meal and you don't feel well, have transportation issues and NOT because you found a better offer, you MUST contact me by calling or texting me at (617) 445-7549 or email at snowrover@yahoo.com. This keeps us from worrying about you and waiting for you unnecessarily.

Please be considerate of your fellow diners time by arriving promptly.

Please bring enough CASH to pay for your meal, drinks, tip, and tax.

You may only RSVP YES or NO. Maybe isn't an option.

Please RSVP YES only if you are certain you will attend.

If your name appears on the event page as a YES after the meetup and you have not attended, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If any guests you've RSVPd for NO-SHOW each will count as if you've NO-SHOWED.

If you change your RSVP from a YES to a NO within an hour of the meetup, without contacting me, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

NO-SHOWS impact everyone; from you, who could or has been on the wait list to the organizer as well as the restaurant's who staff based on our reservation.

An email from you explaining your absence is an expected courtesy.

Your feedback is appreciated so, rate the event and venue by completing surveys afterward.

I will arrive at Hei La Moon by 10:45 AM to arrange seating as well as welcome you.
item.how_to_find_us: Call/text my cell (617) 445 7549 to find us

group.name: Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, & Dinner Meetup Group

item.name: Hei La Moon Dim Sum
